posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Weâ€™re releasing the Signal 7.45 beta soon. If youâ€™re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

â˜… Mainly background work + bug fixes

Complete list of new commits since 7.44.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.44.2â€¦main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Comparing v7.44.2...main Â· signalapp/Signal-Android Â· GitHub
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.44 release
Signal keeps closing after I tried to post a story!

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.45.0 (155100)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

48 new commits since 7.44.2:

Show commits

  • Add crossfade to action-mode toolbar. [1]

  • Fix archive export tests. [2]

  • Reset backup auth credentials on verification failure. [3]

  • Use config to determine deletion lifespan in storage service. [4]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.53.0 [5]

  • Fix story reactions rendering improperly after restoring a backup. [6]

  • Fix read calls being shown as unread in backups. [7]

  • API changes associated with update to libsignal 0.74.0 [8]

  • Fix path escaping issues. [9]

    Acknowledgment to Mouad & Ostorlab team for bringing this to our attention.

  • Calculate remote backup media quota usage locally. [10]

  • Allow staging users to utilize internal backup switch. [11]

  • Add logging to check purchase information on RemoteBackupsSettings screen. [12]

  • Add test case for folder without chat. [13]

  • Fix chat folder test. [14]

  • Switch the snapshot table to use incrementing versions. [15]

  • Split archive deletes and reconciliations into separate jobs. [16]

  • Properly order attachment archive copies. [17]

  • Update remove from group copy. [18]

  • Fix multiselect to make in memory messages unselectable. [19]

  • Ensure that we have the latest recipient copy after refreshing serviceIds. [20]

    Fixes #14163

  • Update optimize media threshold to 7 days. [21]

  • Fix missing profile avatars on restore. [22]

  • Add insufficient storage error message to link+sync. [23]

  • Fix lint. [24]

  • Fix backup receipt crash. [25]

  • Add new dialog and sheet for handling offloaded media after a subscription is canceled or expires. [26]

  • Add UX for out of remote storage space error presentation. [27]

  • Don't skip cancelled google purchase when checking subscription state in check job. [28]

  • Update archiveReconciliationSyncInterval to use global config. [29]

  • Add proper media ttl to restore screen. [30]

  • Fix crash when accessing backup settings without being logged into Google. [31]

  • Improve speed/feedback of final steps of backup restore. [32]

  • Fix copy for no backup key bottom sheet. [33]

  • Prevent viewing backup key when unregistered. [34]

  • Update edit message timestamp. [35]

  • Show entire create backup sheet. [36]

  • Do not run subscription check if backups are disabled. [37]

  • Add backup alert fragment tag to prevent concurrent opens. [38]

  • Add check before setting downgrade flag. [39]

  • Remove deprecated PNI initialization job. [40]

  • Add archive state indicator to media chat items. [41]

  • Log inserted messageIds. [42]

  • Add foreign key reference to notification profile members. [43]

  • Convert AttachmentCipherTest to kotlin. [44]

  • Upload large backup attachments using a foreground service. [45]

  • Update translations and other static files. [46]

  • Update baseline profile. [47]

  • Bump version to 7.45.0 [48]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.44.2â€¦v7.45.0

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

Fix missing profile avatars on restore. [22]

This is great!

I donâ€™t wanna sound like Iâ€™m requesting features, but in my experience, backup restores donâ€™t include theme settings, such as chat backgrounds and colors, either and it could (should?) be added.

Has anyone restored a backup recently to confirm if itâ€™s still the case?

posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

Allow staging users to utilize internal backup switch. [11]

Will cloud backups have a similar staging testing environment like usernames?

posts.name: ðŸ‘ŠðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ”¥
posts.cooked: [insert itâ€™s happening gif]

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Will cloud backups have a similar staging testing environment like usernames?

Hopefully soon :) 20 characters

I donâ€™t know if this should be reported here, but just to be sure Iâ€™ll mention my report from the last thread about edited messages and trailing whitespace:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.44 release Android Beta Feedback
Trailing whitespace in messages is trimmed. But when you edit a message and just append a space at the end and save the edit, a new entry is added to the edit history. Because the space is removed, the new message is essentially the same as the old one and no edited label should be added. https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.2/4136e9f258826cd908e8c0ea4a83c239628778f7bd6b160f5e40fa419d7fdda9 Screenshot

Has anyone restored a backup recently to confirm if itâ€™s still the case?

posts.cooked:
Leibi:

When reacting to a message with a link in it, the link will be opened.

I tried to repro this but couldnâ€™t. Iâ€™d long press on the message and then pick a reaction. Any addition repro steps would be helpful. If I long press on the link it self it copies but doesnâ€™t open.

TeeJay82:

Restored yesterday. Colours were transferred, wallpapers and avatars (other than the current one) werenâ€™t.

The commits are related to the new backup system not the existing local or device transfer systems.

Signal keeps closing after I tried to post a story!

posts.name: ðŸ‘ŠðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ”¥
posts.cooked:
Donâ€™t know if this is new or intended, but if I forward a GIF, it stays a GIF. If I expand it and use the share button, it gets converted to mp4. I think it might be intended because sharing means the media will potentially be sent to an app outside of Signal.

Forwarded message ID

1749947058936

Shared message ID

1749947112034

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.45.1/47e61db2d726a7f467f072bcc16a037365406d88c7f532137010029c02ec4dc3

I just had a â€œchecking for messagesâ€ notification where the progress bar just kept â€œidlingâ€. When I opened Signal, I immediately got a notification for a message from two minutes ago, ID 1749975259354

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.45.1/88bf6c34d23160ce8e4cf6e0baf34afee75a313ec4209bca568de6d05121b5a3

cody-signal:

I tried to repro this but couldnâ€™t.

I also canâ€™t at any other message.
Will post again if the same happens again.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Donâ€™t know if this is new or intended, but if I forward a GIF, it stays a GIF. If I expand it and use the share button, it gets converted to mp4. I think it might be intended because sharing means the media will potentially be sent to an app outside of Signal.

Fun fact: all the â€œGIFsâ€ sent through Signal are actually MP4s, we just render them like a GIF :) So sharing just shares the actual file, which is an MP4, whereas forwarding we do special stuff to keep rendering it like a GIF :)

BaptEash:

When recording in cars, the lack of detail in the treble makes the audio/voice messages very muffled.

Are you recording with your carâ€™s microphone? In our experience, itâ€™s not that the recording settings are bad, but rather bluetooth microphones are bad, and itâ€™s hard to get good recordings from them.

posts.name: Bapt Eash
posts.cooked: No, I only use the microphones in my phone. On Messenger (I know eww Metaâ€¦) the audio is perfect but on Signal itâ€™s always muffled. Both on a Samsung S9 and a newer A35.

posts.name: Masqueey
posts.cooked:
Could it be that when recording a voice note it uses a different microphone? I also sometimes have issues with headphones that it doesnâ€™t immediately select Bluetooth. It could be that for audio notes it selects one microphone when you actually want to use a different one for that recording specifically.

You could check that with someone on a call, cycle between the different microphones and see if one of them is what youâ€™re hearing in your voice notes/recordings.

posts.name: Bapt Eash
posts.cooked:
Itâ€™s not the microphone at fault. Itâ€™s Signal super low bitrate (37kbps !!) for voice messages. We need an option to set it higher.

The cut-off is at 9kHz :

image854Ã—473 142 KB

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: That could absolutely be because of a microphoneâ€™s specs. If it were the case with all microphones, you would have many more users complaining. Voice messages from Signal use the Opus codec which is very efficient without sacrificing quality, and as a consequence I think they sound great usually.
